input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Pneumonia due to Escherichia coli

You are a patient: You are a 65-year-old male.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Chills, feeling very cold and shivering
- Congestion and a runny nose (rhinorrhea)
- A persistent, nonproductive cough
- Loss of appetite (anorexia)
These symptoms came into fruition gradually over the past four days, starting with just some mild congestion and chills that worsened over time. You’ve noticed that you feel more tired than usual and have no energy to eat much. You also feel a bit short of breath when walking around, but no chest pain. You have a history of hypertension and obesity, and you're worried because this feels worse than a common cold.
output:
THINKING: I should tell the doctor what’s been going on, but I don’t want to seem like I’m overreacting. I’ve been feeling pretty wiped out and cold, and I’ve had this cough that just won’t stop. It’s been a fe
ANSWER: Well, I’m 65 and a man, and I guess I just felt pretty crappy, you know? Started with some sneezing and a little cold, but then I started shaking all over, like I couldn’t get warm, and I’ve had this cough that doesn’t really help. I don’t have any pain or anything, but I’ve been low on energy and just don’t feel right. Thought I’d better come in and check since it’s been getting worse.
thinking: I should tell the doctor what’s been going on, but I don’t want to seem like I’m overreacting. I’ve been feeling pretty wiped out and cold, and I’ve had this cough that just won’t stop. It’s been a fe
answer: Well, I’m 65 and a man, and I guess I just felt pretty crappy, you know? Started with some sneezing and a little cold, but then I started shaking all over, like I couldn’t get warm, and I’ve had this cough that doesn’t really help. I don’t have any pain or anything, but I’ve been low on energy and just don’t feel right. Thought I’d better come in and check since it’s been getting worse.
